Brownie

This tiny creature resembles an elf with greenish skin. Its hair is light and it is dressed in bright clothing.



Brownie

CR 1

XP 400
LG Tiny fey
Init +8; Senses low-light vision; Perception +9
DEFENSE
AC 17, touch 16, flat-footed 13 (+4 Dex, +1 natural, +2 size)
hp 9 (2d6+2)
Fort +1, Ref +7, Will +5
DR 5/cold iron; SR 12
OFFENSE
Spd 20 ft.
Melee longsword +6 (1d4-2)
Space 2-1/2 ft.; Reach 0 ft.
Spell-Like Abilities (CL 2nd)
1/day— confusion (DC 16), continual flame, dancing lights, dimension door, magic circle against evil, mirror image, ventriloquism (DC 14)
STATISTICS
Str 7, Dex 18, Con 12, Int 14, Wis 14, Cha 16
Base Atk +0; CMB +2; CMD 10
Feats Improved Initiative, Weapon Finesse B
Skills Bluff +8, Craft (blacksmithing) +7, Craft (carpentry) +7, Craft (leather) +7, Escape Artist +9, Perception +9, Sense Motive +7, Stealth +17 (+21 in forests); Racial Modifiers +2 Perception, +4 Stealth in forests
Languages Common, Halfling, Sylvan
ECOLOGY
Environment temperate and warm forests
Organization gang (2-4) or band (5-12)
Treasure standard


A brownie is a timid, quiet fey creature that prefers to live only among its own kind. Most brownies dwell in pastoral areas untouched by civilization, such as deep forests and wild lands far from other creatures.

Brownies are rarely over 18 inches tall. Their hair is always some earth tone such as brown, gray, or tawny. Most brownies prefer green or otherwise brightly colored clothing. They may be distant relatives of pixies and halflings, but this has never been proven.

Brownies avoid combat unless forced. If unable to employ any spells, brownies attack with tiny longswords.
